page.title: 06General Practitioner,St Ives
page.content: This GP has been a doctor since 1969 and has worked in St Ives since 1973. He works in a group practice because he likes working with other doctors and between them they can provide better facilities for the patients. There are four doctors in his practice, three men and one lady. One of the doctors works part time. Altogether he has about 2500 patients. Usually he works one night a week and one Saturday in two months. On average there is one emergency every day. Sometimes he may get a patient with an illness he doesn't know about and has to tell this to the patient. His surgery opens at 9.00 am so he doesn't have to get up too early. If he is ill he usually treats himself but if he is worried he sees his own doctor. Although it can be very wearing, he enjoys his job immensely.
